title: [K-12] Analysis of Frustration Factors in Collaborative Learning and Learner-Tailored Design Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Digital Device Usage Skills and Language Learning Experience
context.additional_context: Requires collaborative learning design using simulation/VR tools in a limited technological environment centered on smartphones. Learner diversity is categorized into five personas: goal-oriented collaborators, fairness-oriented independent learners, learning-oriented collaborators, instruction-dependent learners, and adaptive collaborators.

learning_goals: Learners analyze at least three major frustration factors in collaborative learning using Q methodology-based surveys and discussions.
Learners design and apply at least two customized collaborative strategies in a simulated environment based on learner types.
Learners propose at least one solution to address role distribution and communication issues among learners in VR-based project assessments.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
